sentences: Mul on head tööga hakkama saada.
context: The word 'tööga' is an Estonian adessive case form of the noun 'töö', which means 'work'. In this form, it indicates accompaniment or instrumentality - showing that something is done with work, by using work as a tool or method, or through labor. It answers the question 'how?' or 'with what?'. The '-ga' suffix in Estonian typically indicates accompaniment when used with nouns.
